senses.de: The effect or influence of one thing on another
senses.ex: The impact of globalization on small businesses is significant.

Tips.title: Wide Scope
Tips.description: Think broad when using 'impact' to describe effects that could range from tiny to massive.
Tips.example: Social media has a wide-ranging impact on public opinion.

Tips.title: Abstract Ideas
Tips.description: Use 'impact' for intangible effects, like emotions or thoughts, not just physical changes.
Tips.example: The film had a profound impact on his understanding of culture.

Tips.title: Long-Lasting Effect
Tips.description: Impacts can be enduring, affecting future events or development over time.
Tips.example: Her research had a lasting impact on the scientific community.

senses.de: The force of a collision or hit

Tips.title: Physical Force
Tips.description: Emphasize the physical contact when 'impact' refers to a literal collision.
Tips.example: The boxer's punch made a loud impact against the bag.

Tips.title: Damage Potential
Tips.description: Consider the potential damage or alteration when mentioning an 'impact'.
Tips.example: The impact from the fall left a dent in the metal surface.

senses.de: To have a strong effect on someone or something
senses.ex: The teacher's advice really impacted me.

Tips.title: Emotional Influence
Tips.description: Describe the emotional or motivational influence when 'impact' is used as a verb.
Tips.example: Her story impacted him to start volunteering.

Tips.title: Change Agent
Tips.description: Use 'impact' to indicate someone or something acting as an agent of change.
Tips.example: New policies are expected to impact climate change efforts.

senses.ex: The meteor impacted the Earth creating a large crater.

Tips.title: Sudden Contact
Tips.description: Stress the suddenness and immediacy of contact when 'impact' involves a physical hit.
Tips.example: The hailstones impacted the roof with great force.

Tips.title: Direct Hit
Tips.description: Use 'impact' to underscore the directness of a hit or strike, without any deflection.
Tips.example: The bullet impacted the target in the center.

Consequence.wordDefinition:
Consequence usually refers to the result of a particular action or situation, implying a cause-and-effect relationship.

For example, if someone fails to study for a test, the consequence will likely be a poor grade.

Consequence is the result of an action, while impact is the effect of an action. Each word is applicable in different contexts, such as discussing the consequences of breaking a rule or the impact of technology on society.

Effect.wordDefinition:
Effect and impact are related words that can both refer to the results of something. The difference is in their degree of intensity.

Effect typically refers to a more mild or indirect result. For example, you might say that one of the effects of a rainy day is that people stay indoors more.

Effect is a more general term that can refer to any kind of outcome, while impact is usually reserved for more significant or dramatic results.

Important.wordDefinition:
Important refers to something that has significance or value, such as a person, event, or thing. It implies that something is relevant or necessary and can be used in many contexts.

For example, a test might be important for a student's grade, or a meeting might be important for a business.

Important refers to significance or relevance, while impact refers to a direct or indirect effect or influence.

Impression.wordDefinition:
Impression refers to a perception or feeling that one gets about something or somebody.

It is usually used in reference to the way something or somebody appears or feels. For example, "His kind words left a lasting impression on me.".

Impact relates to a change or effect, while impression relates to a feeling or perception.

Influence.wordDefinition:
Influence on the other hand refers to the ability to affect or change the behavior, opinion or thinking of others over a period of time.

It describes the indirect or subtle effect something has on someone else. For example, a role model may have a positive influence on a teenager's life and help them make better choices.

Impact refers to the immediate effect of something while influence refers to the long-term effect that can shape and mold someone's attitudes or behavior.

Outcome.wordDefinition:
Outcome means the result or consequence of an action or event.

It describes what happens as a result of a particular action or event. For example, the outcome of a football game is determined by which team has more points at the end of the game.

So, in simple terms, impact refers to the effect that something has, while outcome refers to the result or consequence of something.

Impact is applicable when talking about the effect of something on something else, while outcome is applicable when talking about the result of an action or event.

Result.wordDefinition:
Result refers to the outcome or consequence of something. For example, if a student studies hard for an exam, the result may be a good grade.

Result is used when we want to talk about what happened as a direct consequence of something else.

Impact is used when we want to talk about the force of influence that one thing has on another, while result is used when we want to talk about the outcome or consequence of something.

Significance.wordDefinition:
Significance refers to the importance or meaning of something. It suggests that something has a larger or deeper meaning beyond its superficial qualities.

For example, the significance of a historical event may be in its impact on shaping the world as we know it today.

Impact is often used when discussing more tangible and immediate effects, while significance is used when discussing more abstract and long-term effects or meanings.

Weight.wordDefinition:
Weight refers to the amount of force that is being applied by an object. For example, if you stand on a weighing scale, the weight that is displayed is the amount of force that you exert on the scale due to gravity.

Weight is applicable when we want to describe the amount of pressure or force being exerted.

So, in short, impact describes the consequence or result of something, whereas weight describes the amount of force or pressure being applied.

quotes.Text: To spend more money, you have to have more money, but time is fixed and we all have the same amount to spare. How we choose to spend it can make a significant difference on the impact we have in our careers or in the world.
quotes.Title: English Author
quotes.Name: Simon Sinek

quotes.Text: The most impactful dollars that Australia can spend are actually what goes to help the poorest.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Bill Gates

quotes.Text: A life is not important except in the impact it has on other lives.
quotes.Title: American Baseball Player
quotes.Name: Jackie Robinson

quotes.Text: My life is not to be somebody else's impact - you know what I mean?
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Alice Walker

quotes.Text: I can't influence or impact where the NRA goes and spends money.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Richard Burr

quotes.Text: I want to leave a deep impact of my acting in people's mind.
quotes.Title: Indian Actress
quotes.Name: Padmapriya Janakiraman

quotes.Text: I want to make a good impact on the K-pop music world.
quotes.Title: South Korean Musician
quotes.Name: Lee Tae-min

quotes.Text: Tennis has had a very positive impact on my life.
quotes.Title: Argentinian Athlete
quotes.Name: Gabriela Sabatini

quotes.Text: Everything we do impacts someone else's life.
quotes.Title: Actor
quotes.Name: Nicolas Cage

quotes.Text: The airplane has had a big impact on my life.
quotes.Title: American Athlete
quotes.Name: Jim Courier
